body: Hi my friend I have a question in ladybug sun pat analysis. I watched your movie and I do what ever you said, But I dont know why my shading designer is bigger than the surface that I choosed. I realy dont know what should I do. Thank you Mojde[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/tFu4DrQFBvFqwqfQg5F4dPrF5RSh8*REJc0vFJBv3tmBRBOG6ICeCUuwlo4RJYCvBSTYryQiKBGg*a9r8LErjoC*Tx9z5kKe/1.5.jpg) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/tFu4DrQFBvHpPLCrAHfRTjupkqwxwatcjrkVjPrS2U3yEsPUIxdsaetBUJYTQf6f*bEEF0KStUKQfjafYYs8fZcPEKFeW0Jh/shadingdesigner.jpg)

replies.body:
Mojde 



Can you please upload your file?
Sharing the file definitely helps. Check the input surface that you're connecting to the shading designer.

Hi Mostafa

I cheked the surface as you said but it happened again. And I choosed another suface but again it became too big. I dont know how check the size of shading designer that it becom smaller than it?

 

Best

Mojde
Hi I attach the file as you said.

Hi Mojde,

Sorry for the late reply. It's because a number of vectors are almost parallel to the surface. I suggest to study a single day before using the shading designer for an analysis period. That should help you to understand the process behind calculating shadings.

Mostapha
Mostapha, Do you think there should be check for this?
